thread.title: Businesses Vulnerable with Use of Windows XP & Server 2003; Enitech’s Mission to Keep N.C. Companies Safe with Complimentary Unsupported & Unsecure Software Audit
thread.title_full: Businesses Vulnerable with Use of Windows XP & Server 2003; Enitech’s Mission to Keep N.C. Companies Safe with Complimentary Unsupported & Unsecure Software Audit

author: Antwine Jackson
title: Businesses Vulnerable with Use of Windows XP & Server 2003; Enitech’s Mission to Keep N.C. Companies Safe with Complimentary Unsupported & Unsecure Software Audit
text:
Enitech IT Support and Consulting, a managed service provider (MSP) offering IT solutions for small businesses throughout the State of North Carolina, today announced that it is offering a free Unsupported and Unsecure Software Audit for businesses potentially endangering their viability by using outdated technology, such as Windows XP and Windows Server 2003. The complimentary audit is available through September 30, 2015. “There is an enormous cost associated with the continued use of outdated business software,” said Antwine Jackson, President, Enitech. “It’s costing many small businesses hundreds of dollars each year to keep using XP, and it’s going to cost others hundreds of thousands of dollars to continue to support Server 2003. By making available this timely and free audit, businesses can easily upgrade to the latest operating systems to avoid unnecessary costs, minimize downtime and increase productivity.”
With the recent expiration of popular Windows operating systems and even other out-of-date business software, companies run these risks by using outdated technology:
 Crashes and system downtime as businesses waste time fixing IT issues rather than focusing on their business. Increased costs as businesses spend money fixing IT issues instead of growing their business. Decreased productivity as employees work to resolve IT issues instead of focusing on business tasks. Security holes as outdated software leaves businesses open to cyberattacks. Legal and regulatory compliance risks as auditors fine companies that migrate from unsupported software.
To learn more about Enitech’s free Unsupported and Unsecure Software Audit and to order one today, please visit http://www.enitechsolutions.com or call 877.952.8324.
About Enitech IT Support & Consulting
Enitech is a RTP-based managed service provider (MSP) that offers IT support and business solutions to small businesses as well as healthcare and dental providers throughout the State of North Carolina, made up of Wilmington, Chapel Hill, Raleigh, Durham, Greensboro, Winston Salem, Charlotte, Asheville, and surrounding areas. Some of the company’s most popular network solutions include remote management and monitoring with antivirus; remote backup and disaster recovery; managed firewall and security; hardware as a service; and cloud services. Enitech provides managed IT services for a variety of industries, including dental, healthcare, retail, real estate and non-profits. Enitech enitechsolutions.com. 877.952.8324.
